column5: I know some get them when their new,but for others just picked up a Raven cover for my Okuma from The Fishing Depot. $15.00 plus tax.Again trying to find one ,no body had in the Barrie area or the common places in the central GTA. If your thinking about one ,he has a few.
The Okuma covers are nice and big.
Bill didn't have much of a option,this is from what I see and they told me It's more than big enough.Will put on later this evening.Will you know.
What are you protecting them against at home? When I see them in pictures they're always either submerged in a brown river or laying in the sand and rocks on shore. I'm missing something here.
Mostly banging around in my work truck when I'm trying to get a couple hours in on a slow day.
If you need a cover they are available at www.centrepinangling.com
Daiwa has a pretty good one. I got mine at lebarron's. The one i got houses my 5 1/4 reel nicely with rod attached
Why would Daiwa have one?   Davey,if yer down that way again,I could use one.
I was wondering the same thing, it's probably for a salt water spinning reel

The best neoprene covers are made by Bare.  You can buy them online at centerpinangling.com along with ones made by Islander, Kingpin, Okuma and Raven.  Great prices, great service and super fast shipping from these guys.  http://centerpinangling.com/parts_maintenance.html
